div.p: No. 724, vol. 1877 L, VPRS 1168/P inward correspondence registers, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Letter not found. Item is a register entry only, of a letter dated 19 January 1877.
[Asks that engravings of gum trees Wattles &c be prepared his work on popular plants for schools]
That is,forB77.08.01,the workfor schoolsthatreplaced the version aborted by MacPherson on 22 November 1876 (see Lucas et. al. (2009), pp. 37-9, and notes to M to J. MacPherson, 21 March 1876).
M'sletter was returned tohimon 25 January 1877,minuted by MacPherson: ‘I dont know such a work is going on’. M responded to MacPherson’s minute on 29 January and was given approval for his original request on 1 February. M responded again on 7 February and was told the same day: ‘MS can be sent to Printer’.A request for an advance to pay for the engravings was made inM toJ.MacPherson, 14 April 1877.
In his introductionMoutlined the origin of B77.08.01 as a ministerial request that the publication of the planned volume, 'ready for comparatively cheap issue',bereplaced by a smaller publication on Gum-trees, Wattles and other leading plants' (p. 4). No written stipulation of this kind has been found, but M evidently persuaded MacPherson to support thepublication.
